basis: The user expresses ongoing hesitancy and states they may skip the check-in; they describe difficulty reliably tracking notes due to irregular meals and being highly influenced by surroundings. This suggests low likelihood of following the current suggestion in the near term.
cognitive_dissonance: Tension between wanting ultra-optional, non-pushy support and feeling overwhelmed by surroundings and meal irregularity; desire for control vs. fear of change.
negative_thought_patterns: Avoidant coping (prefers to skip steps), all-or-nothing thinking (“ultra-optional” but no commitment), potential fear of failure when attempting self-monitoring.
emotional_triggers: Environmental pull (surroundings), irregular eating patterns, heat/physical discomfort, anxiety about changing routines.
coaching_notes: Maintain ultra-optional framing; avoid pushing for steps. Offer micro-options only if truly optional, and acknowledge if the user needs to pause or involve clinician support. Propose simple, non-intrusive check-ins only when the user signals readiness.
